snippet: Fazil Say, who has said he is an atheist and has criticized Turkey’s pro-Islamic government, is accused of “publicly insulting religious values.”
abstract: Istanbul court charges pianist Fazil Say, with insulting Islamic values in Twitter messages, latest in a series of legal actions against Turkish artists, writers and intellectuals for statements they have made about religion and Turkish national identity; trial is scheduled to begin on Oct 18, with Say facing up to 18 months in prison if convicted.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and DANIEL J. WAKIN
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Istanbul, and Daniel J. Wakin from New York.

lead_paragraph: Fazil Say, who has said he is an atheist and has criticized Turkey’s pro-Islamic government, is accused of “publicly insulting religious values.”

headline.seo: Turkey Charges Pianist Fazil Say Over Twitter Posts
headline.main: Turkish Pianist Is Accused of Insulting Islam
headline.print_headline: Turkish Pianist Is Accused of Insulting Islam

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
